article.para: Welcome to eXist-db. This article serves as an index to the eXist-db documentation articles, which will help you getting to know, installing and using eXist.

note.para: This article is stripped from its original contents and will re-grow during the re-writing of the documentation 1Q18.

sect1.title: Getting Started
sect1.para: The following articles and resources will help you getting started using eXist.

listitem.para: Basic Installation: How to install and fire up eXist-db for basic installation and usage.
For the first steps with your freshly installed eXist-db, watch the screencasts available on the eXist-db homepage.
Dashboard: Learn how to use and populate eXist-db's main user interface, the dashboard.
Uploading files: Learn how to get files in and populate your database.

sect1.title: XQuery
sect1.para: eXist-db's main programming language is XQuery. This documentation set does not contain a full introduction to XQuery. For this read the excellent book about XQuery by Priscilla Walmsley. The XQuery related articles below specific eXist-db related details.

listitem.para: Debugger will tell you how to debug XQuery code on the server using Emacs or VIM.

sect1.title: Application development
sect1.para: eXist-db is not only a database but also an excellent application development platform. The following articles will help you find your way in this:

listitem.para: The beginners guide to XRX will learn you how to create a simple application using XRX (XForms, REST, XQuery).
Content extraction shows ho to extract and index non-XML contents, like PDF or Word documents.

sect1.title: Operations
sect1.para: Operations is the art of installing eXist-db and keeping it up-and-running professionally. This includes things like more advanced installation types, doing backups and restores, automate data transfers, etc.

listitem.para: Configuration: How to configure eXist-db using its main configuration file conf.xml.
Backups: How to backup and restore an eXist-db database.
Advanced Installation: How to install eXist-db on a headless (no GUI) system and run it as a service.
Ant tasks: How to use the specific eXist-db Ant tasks to automate common system administration and operation tasks.
Building eXist: How to build Java .jar or .war files from an eXist distribution.
